justification: "…participants were asked to rate on a scale from 10 to 100% (with increments of 10) the likelihood of the suspect's guilt."
"Finally, participants had to indicate whether or not they would convict the suspect (yes/no)."

topic_or_construct: confirmation bias (impact of guilt-confirming vs exonerating evidence)
measured_by: difference in guilt estimates between confirmation and exoneration conditions
justification: "This analysis yielded a significant main effect of confirmation bias … the dependent variable was the guilt estimate expressed as difference from the mean guilt estimate in the control condition."

topic_or_construct: feature positive effect (impact of evidence found vs not found)
measured_by: difference in guilt estimates between successful and failed evidence-search conditions
justification: "…a nearly significant main effect of the FPE … of primary interest … was the divergence from the mean in the control group … finding evidence … had more impact on guilt estimates than did not finding the same evidence."
